content.FILE_MISSION_10C: clear_screen print("########################") print("#### DUNGEON SEEKER ####") print("########################\n") user_input("-- Press any key --", false, true) clear_screen GetSelectedAction = function(answer) input_player = answer.trim().split(" ") finalAction = "" for item in input_player for action in levelA if action.indexOf(item) != null and finalAction.indexOf(item) == null then finalAction = finalAction + item.trim() + " " end if end for end for return finalAction.trim() end function AskPlayer = function() answer = user_input("Type action: ") selectedAction = GetSelectedAction(answer) while levelA.indexOf(selectedAction) == null print("You can't do " + answer) answer = user_input("Type action: ") selectedAction = GetSelectedAction(answer) end while return selectedAction end function CheckWolf = function(wolfPresent) if wolfPresent then print("When you walk through the door you hear a roar behind you, as soon as you turn around, you see the wolf leans upon you") exit("Game Over: You've been eaten by the wolf") end if end function helpActions = ["look", "walk", "attack", "pick", "open"] inventory = [] wolfPresent = true levelA = ["exit", "walk light", "look entrance", "walk cave", "pick torch", "attack wolf", "look doors", "walk right door", "walk left door", "attack wolves", "look wolves", "look chest", "open chest", "look light", "look wolf", "help"] intro = "You've been walking tirelessly for days, and constant rain makes your movements difficult.\n\nIn the distance you glimpse a dim light" print(intro) selectedAction = AskPlayer() idxAction = levelA.indexOf(selectedAction) while idxAction != 0 if idxAction == 1 then print("You approach carefully towards the light, and you see that it is a torch that illuminates the entrance of a cave") end if if idxAction == 2 then print("The entrance to the cave has a small roof that prevents the torch from going out in the rain. The interior is dark and you cannot see beyond.") end if if idxAction == 4 then print("You take the torch by the base and pull it firmly out of the holder") print("+1 Torch") inventory.push("Torch") end if if idxAction == 3 then if inventory.indexOf("Torch") == null then print("You enter the cave, you cannot see anything and you walk forward with your arms outstretched while the sounds of your footsteps echo off the rock of the cave walls") print("You hear a breath approaching you, faster and faster until it becomes a continuous growl. You cover your face with your arms as something pounces on you") exit("Game Over: You have been eaten by an unknown creature") else print("You enter with the torch in your hand and you walk down a corridor until you reach a square room, with two doors. In the middle of the room there is a big wolf staring at you.") end if end if if idxAction == 5 then print("You approach the wolf slowly moving the torch quickly from one side to the other. The wolf flicks his ears back and runs out the door on the right.") wolfPresent = false end if if idxAction == 6 then print("You see two doors in front of you, with thick frames made of stone. You see something sparkle in the door on the right") end if if idxAction == 7 then CheckWolf(wolfPresent) print("You enter through the door on the right, and you begin to walk down another long corridor, which narrows more and more until it opens onto a small circular room.") print("You see what looks like the lair of a family of wolves, there are remains of animal corpses and some dirty blankets.") print("From various corners of the room you begin to see how several wolves appear before you, showing their teeth and roaring.") end if if idxAction == 9 then print("You start to violently swing the torch towards the wolves but before you know it they are pouncing on you") exit("Game Over: You have been eaten by a pack of wolves") end if if idxAction == 10 then print("You look at the wolves and notice that they have a reddish color to their eyes, their growls increasing as thick drool slides between their teeth. Before you can react they pounce on you.") exit("Game Over: You have been eaten by a pack of wolves") end if if idxAction == 8 then print("You enter through the door on the left, go up some stairs that lead to a small room where in the middle there is an ornate chest") end if if idxAction == 11 then print("It is not a very large chest. It is decorated with all kinds of jewelry.") end if if idxAction == 12 then print("While you open the chest an intense light is escaping from its interior and invading the room until you open it completely.") print("The light is blinding but you struggle to look inside") exit(">>>>> $IP_IDX2 <<<<<") end if if idxAction == 13 then print("You look at the light and see that it flutters slightly, it could be the light of a torch") end if if idxAction == 14 then print("The animal shows its teeth while not looking away from you") end if if idxAction == 15 then print("List of available actions: ") for action in helpActions print("- " + action) end for print("Example: look light") end if selectedAction = AskPlayer() idxAction = levelA.indexOf(selectedAction) end while

Prompt = function()
	output = user_input("> ", false, false)
	parts = output.trim.split(" ")

	while parts.len != 3
		if output.trim == "help" then
			print("Operators: + - * /\nExample usage: 2 + 2")
		else
			print("Wrong arguments.\nExample usage: 2 + 2")
		end if
		output = user_input("> ", false, false)
		parts = output.split(" ")
	end while
	return parts
end function

parts = Prompt()
operator = parts[1]
if operator == "+" then
	print(parts[0].val + parts[2].val)
else if operator == "*" then
	print(parts[0].val * parts[2].val)
else if operator == "-" then
	print(parts[0].val - parts[2].val)
else if operator == "/" then
	print(parts[0].val / parts[2].val)
else
	print("Uknown operator: " + parts[1])
end if

content.DOC_FILE_ALLOW_IMPORT: [Parameters] None [Description] Returns true if the file is binary and can be imported by other scripts, false otherwise.
content.DOC_BLOCKCHAIN_COIN_PRICE: [Parameters] [1] string coinName [Description] Returns an int with the current unit value of the currency. In case of error a string is returned with the details.
content.DOC_BLOCKCHAIN_CREATE_COIN: [Parameters] [1] string name [2] string user [3] string password [4] string address [Description] Create a cryptocurrency with the specified name and credentials that will be used to access the details of the coin from the blockchain.get_coin method. You need a valid address that will be shown to users who do not have the currency, indicating where to register. In case of error a string with the details is returned.
content.DOC_SUBWALLET_MINING: [Parameters] None [Description] Starts the process of mining the cryptocurrency. The process leaves the terminal busy until a coin is mined, returning true
content.DOC_BLOCKCHAIN_CREATE_WALLET: [Parameters] [1] string usuario [2] string password [Description] Returns an object of type wallet, used to manage cryptocurrencies. In case of error a string is returned with the details.
content.DOC_WALLET_SHOW_NODES: [Parameters] [1] string coinName [Description] Returns an int indicating the number of devices mining a specific coin for the same wallet. In case of error a string is returned with the details.
content.DOC_BLOCKCHAIN_LOGIN_WALLET: [Parameters] [1] string user [2] string password [Description] Returns a wallet type object or a string in case of error indicating the reason.
content.DOC_WALLET_LIST_COINS: [Parameters] None [Description] Returns a string list with the names of the coins available in the wallet.
content.DOC_WALLET_GET_BALANCE: [Parameters] [1] string coinName [Description] Returns an int with the number of coins of a given currency. In case of error, a string with the details is returned.
content.DOC_COIN_TRANSACTION: [Parameters] [1] string origSubWallet [2] string destSubWallet [3] int amount [Description] Make a transaction of the currency between the indicated subwallets. In case of error, a string with the details is returned.
content.DOC_WALLET_BUY_COIN: [Parameters] [1] string currencyName [2] int quantity [3] int UnitPrice [Description] Publish a purchase offer indicating the number of coins you wish to buy and the price ($) per unit you are willing to pay. The purchase will be finalized if there is any sale offer with a price less than or equal to the one proposed in the purchase. If there is no eligible offer to sell at that time, the offer to buy will remain publicly visible until a new offer to sell satisfies the requirements. If the publication has been successful, true is returned, in case of error a string with the details is returned.
content.DOC_WALLET_SELL_COIN: [Parameters] [1] string currencyName [2] int quantity [3] int UnitPrice [Description] Publish a sale offer indicating the amount of coins you want to sell and the price ($) per unit you want to assign. The sale will be finalized if there is any purchase offer with a price greater than or equal to that proposed in the sale. If there is no existing offer to buy that matches the requirements at that time, the offer to sell will remain publicly visible until a new offer to buy satisfies the requirements. If the publication has been successful, true is returned, in case of error a string with the details is returned.
content.DOC_WALLET_GET_PENDING_TRADE: [Parameters] [1] string currencyName [Description] Returns a list with the pending sale or purchase offer of this wallet of a certain currency. Index 0 of the list represents the type of offer with a string (Buy/Sell), index 1 represents the quantity to be sold or bought, and index 2 represents the price per unit.
content.DOC_WALLET_CANCEL_PENDING_TRADE: [Parameters] [1] string currencyName [Description] Cancel any pending offer of a certain coin.
content.WALLET_DETAIL: Program to manage the wallet in text mode to be used from the Terminal
content.STOCKS_DETAIL: Program that displays information on all published coins as well as pending offers.
content.DOC_WALLET_GET_GLOBAL_OFFERS: [Parameters] [1] string currencyName [Description] Returns a map with all the offers made by any player of a given currency. The Key of the map represents the WalletID of the player who has made the offer, The Value of the map is a list where the index 0 represents the type of offer with a string (Buy/Sell), the index 1 represents the amount to sell or buy and the index 2 represents the price per unit.
content.INVALID_OFFER: This offer is no longer valid. There are not enough funds to complete the transaction.
content.DOC_WALLET_LIST_GLOBAL_COINS: [Parameters] None [Description] Returns a string list with the names of all the currencies that exist.
content.DOC_BLOCKCHAIN_SHOW_HISTORY: [Parameters] [1] string coinName [Description] Returns a map with the latest changes in the value of a specific currency. The Key of the map is the index represented by an int. Value contains a list, where index 0 is the price of the coin it had in the past, index 1 indicates the date on which the price change occurred.
content.DOC_BLOCKCHAIN_AMOUNT_MINED: [Parameters] [1] string coinName [Description] Returns an int with the number of units of the coin that have been mined in total.
content.DOC_WALLET_GET_PIN: [Parameters] None [Description] Returns a string with a PIN that refreshes every few minutes. This PIN is used to obtain an account in cryptocurrency services.
content.DOC_BLOCKCHAIN_DELETE_COIN: [Parameters] [1] string name [2] string user [3] string password [Description] Remove a crypto currency from the world. The credentials used in the creation of the currency are necessary.
content.DOC_BLOCKCHAIN_GET_COIN: [Parameters] [1] string name [2] string user [3] string password [Description] Returns an object of type Coin used to manage the currency. A string with the details is returned in case of an error.
content.DOC_COIN_CREATE_SUBWALLET: [Parameters] [1] string walletID [2] string pin [3] string subWalletUser [4] string subWalletPass [Description] Register a new account in the Coin that can be used to manage services such as stores. It is necessary to use the PIN that the owner of the wallet that wants to register has to provide.
content.DOC_SUBWALLET_DELETE: [Parameters] None [Description] Delete the account registered in the crypto currency. Returns true on success or a string with the details of the error. It can return false if the account to be deleted does not exist.
content.DOC_COIN_GET_SUBWALLET: [Parameters] [1] string subWalletUser [Description] Returns an object of type SubWallet, in case of error it returns a string with the details.
content.DOC_COIN_GET_SUBWALLETS: [Parameters] None [Description] Returns a list of objects of type SubWallet with all the accounts registered in the crypto currency, in case of error it returns a string with the details.
content.DOC_SUBWALLET_CHECK_PASSWORD: [Parameters] [1] string subWalletPass [Description] Returns true if the credentials are correct, false otherwise.

content.DOC_COIN_SET_CYCLE_MINING: [Parameters] [1] int rateHours [Description] Assign the hours (game time) that each mining cycle lasts. When a cycle ends, it is decided who gets the reward (1 coin) and the next cycle begins.
content.DOC_SUBWALLET_GET_BALANCE: [Parameters] None [Description] Returns an int with the amount of coins that the Subwallet has. In case of error, a string with the details is returned.

content.DOC_SUBWALLET_SET_INFO: [Parameters] [1] string info [Description] Optional information that the coin creator can store in the Subwallet for any use.

content.DOC_SUBWALLET_GET_USER: [Parameters] None [Description] Returns a string with the username associated with this subwallet.

content.TUTORIAL_PAGE_MAIL:
Cool! You already have an internet connection and you have received your first <color=#33cccc>email</color>.

Throughout the game you will find missions similar to this one, it is important that you read the text carefully as any detail can be of great help.

Click <color=orange>Next</color> when you've read the <color=#33cccc>email</color>.
content.TUTORIAL_PAGE_MAIL2:
Right now you don't have the tools available on your computer to try to access the objective directly, so other methods will have to be used to achieve it.

[ACTION] Click the Create new email button [/ACTION]
content.TUTORIAL_PAGE_MAIL4:
<color=orange>Social engineering</color> is a more useful tool than it seems, if used well it can make things much easier to reach your goal.

In the left column you have a list of predefined emails, each of them with a purpose.

In this mission we need to trick the system administrator by pretending to be the victim so that he gives us the access credentials of his computer.

[ACTION] Select the "<color=#33cccc>Login issues</color>" option [/ACTION]
content.TUTORIAL_PAGE_MAIL5:
In social engineering emails you will need to use the correct information in order to trick recipients.

Since the victim works in the same place as the system administrator, you need to know the victim's name to impersonate him.

Fortunately, in the email you received you have the name of the victim, it is enough to use the last name.
content.TUTORIAL_PAGE_MAIL6:
Although now the problem is that we don't know the email address of the administrator.

To know this information you can use the <color=#0FABFFFF>whois</color> terminal program, which by passing it a public IP address offers some basic information about the network.
content.TUTORIAL_PAGE_MAIL7:
If the social engineering works you will get the credentials to be able to access the machine remotely using the <color=#0FABFFFF>ssh</color> terminal program.

Keep in mind that the credentials you get now are not the ones asked for in the mission, you need to find the credentials of the victim's <color=orange>email</color> account.

Once inside the victim's computer, you must search through the folders to find the file with the encrypted password and use the program attached to the <color=orange>email</color> to decrypt it.

Good luck!
content.TOOLTIP_MAIL_LOGIN: Login to a different email account
content.INTRODUCTION_WEBS_MANUAL:
If you have an internet connection you can use the browser to search and access different web pages that can offer you different services.

In Multiplayer mode you can also find websites and services made by other players.
content.MAIL_WEBS_MANUAL: Services are offered to register an email address. You can search for it on the web with the Browser using the keyword mail
content.BANK_WEBS_MANUAL: On these websites you can register a bank account. An email address is required. You can search for it on the web with the Browser using the keyword bank
content.SHOPS_WEBS_MANUAL: In these stores you can get some useful programs that are not installed by default in the Operating System. Also if you want to update your hardware from here you can buy any part you need. Keep in mind that all stores have the same catalog. In MultiPlayer mode the stock is updated every month (two real days) while in SinglePlayer mode the stock is updated every time you access the store. You can search for it on the web with the browser using the keyword shop or store
content.HACKSHOP_WEBS_MANUAL:
The administrators of these pages prefer a low profile, so you cannot find them using the browser. You will have to obtain the address by other methods.

On these websites you can find programs as well as exploits that could be used to access certain systems.

In addition, these websites offer missions that you can accept, receiving a payment if you complete them satisfactorily.
Since these missions often require performing illegal actions, completing them results in an increase in your negative karma.

The content of all hackshops is the same and their catalog of exploits are renewed at the same time.
content.POLICE_WEBS_MANUAL: Police websites offer assignments that may require the capture of criminals. They also have a section available to report any crime that you have discovered on your own even if it is not reflected in the mission list. Completing police missions increases your positive karma. You can find these websites using the keyword police
content.ISP_WEBS_MANUAL: At ISPs (internet provider services) you can hire an internet connection or rent servers. These services require a monthly payment, so if this payment is interrupted, the service stops working until the problem with the payment is resolved. In Multiplayer mode, the monthly payment is paused if the player has not logged into the game for 1 real day, the next time the player re-enters the game the monthly payments are resumed. In SinglePlayer mode payouts are paused as soon as the game is closed. To manage these contracted services, the ConfigLan program is used, which you can download from these web pages. You can find these websites using the keywords internet or rental
content.TUTORIAL_PAGE_CONFIGLAN:
From here you can manage your servers and your internet connection, if you have hired one.

The first step is to choose a network that you have available and press the connect button.
content.TUTORIAL_PAGE_CONFIGLAN2: When connecting you will see a new password field; each new device added will use the same root password that the router uses, unless you manually change it after adding the devices using the appropriate commands like passwd.
content.TUTORIAL_PAGE_CONFIGLAN3: You can add new devices such as routers, computers, and switches to the network in exchange for an increased monthly payment.
content.TUTORIAL_PAGE_CONFIGLAN4:
In the Monthly payment tab you can see the devices that currently make up the network and their total price.

At the end of the list you can see the total payment of all the hired servers.

The monthly payments of the hired servers or internet are paid at the same time, therefore the more servers you rent or devices you add, the larger the monthly payment will be.
content.TUTORIAL_PAGE_CONFIGLAN5:
In the event that the payment cannot be made due to insufficient funds in the bank account, all servers will temporarily stop working until you resolve the problem.

If you can not afford all the payment, you can individually restore the servers you want, charging the amount corresponding to the restored server.
content.TUTORIAL_PAGE_CONFIGLAN6:
To manually restore a server that has been deactivated due to insufficient bank funds, go to the <color=orange>Monthly Invoice</color> tab and click the <color=orange>Restore Payment</color> button.

Make sure you have enough money for this server.
content.TUTORIAL_PAGE_CONFIGLAN7:
If at the end of the next month the total monthly payment still cannot be made, all the servers will be inactive again, so it is a good idea to have hired the services that you know you will be able to afford.

In Multiplayer mode, the monthly payment is paused if the player hasn't logged into the game for 1 real day, the next time the player re-enters the game the monthly payments are resumed. In SinglePlayer mode payouts are paused as soon as the game is closed.

This is all for now, you can now close this window.
content.MANUAL_KARMA:
Every time you complete any mission your <color=orange>reputation</color> will increase allowing you to access new missions or activities.

Also, when solving missions or performing certain actions your karma may change.
Completing Hackshop missions increases your negative karma while performing police missions increases your positive karma.

During the game you can find special missions that are not available on any of these websites in which you can perform extra actions such as notifying the police about a crime or blackmailing the criminal in exchange for your silence, also affecting your karma.

These missions are categorized into two parts: <color=orange>Hidden</color> and <color=orange>Karma</color>

<color=orange>Hidden</color> missions can be found by exploring the world for suspicious files that could lead to a crime, while <color=orange>Karma</color> missions will be notified to you via email after you have reached a certain <color=orange>reputation</color> and will be different depending on the level of karma you have at that moment.

Having a negative karma is not a bad thing, in the same way that having a positive karma does not give any advantage, it is a way to know your current status as a hacker.

You can change your karma at any time by doing missions.
content.MANUAL_GENERAL_TIPS: [ { "title": "", "content": "These are some general tips that can be useful both for accessing certain systems and for protecting yourself from potential attackers." }, { "title": "Hacking networks without ports", "content": "Not all networks have open ports to the outside, so in these cases accessing them can be somewhat more complicated. The most common way to access these networks is to try to hack the router itself, searching for or building an exploit that attacks the kernel_router.so library. Once you have access to the router, it is recommended that you upload the ScanLan program to be able to see the details of the network. From here you will have to reach your target through the local network, jumping from one device to another." }, { "title": "Reverse shell", "content": "Another alternative to closed ports is to use a remote shell, where the victim connects to you instead of you to the victim. To do this you first need to set up an rshell server that will handle receive connections from victims. Once you have the server configured, you should try to get the victim to run a program that makes the connection to your machine without suspecting. To do this, you can use the Social Engineering option "Funny Game" to try to trick the victim by posing as a co-worker. Once the victim has run the program, you will need the rshell-interface program to handle incoming connections." }, { "title": "CCTV", "content": "Some networks, especially the larger ones, may have CCTVs ("closed circuit television") that monitor various interior parts of the building. Accessing these systems is more useful than it seems, as sometimes certain unsuspecting workers may leave information important in view of these cameras. The CCTVs are represented by the icon of a camera in ScanLan. These cameras have an access system through the web, which you can access using the Browser and the IP address of the camera, where you must enter the credentials to access. These credentials are encrypted within the camera's filesystem under the username cctv." }, { "title": "How to avoid being hacked by other players", "content": "There is no single infallible method to achieve this since to obtain good security you have to know the system well and apply different methods depending on the libraries that are installed on your system, as well as any services running such as ssh or http. It is usually a trial and error process until you find the right security on your system, although there are some basic tips you can use to avoid being hacked when you start the game. [Avoid registering your account mail and bank in the first results of the Browser] When you connect to a website, your IP address is recorded in the server logs. Anyone who accesses these logs can see what connections have been made and therefore can reach you, since these first results are the ones that hackers usually review, it is advisable to register on any page that is not among the first results. [Change wifi after visiting certain webs] If you suspect that your IP could be discovered when accessing a system, it is recommended to connect to another Wi-Fi network, so that when any attacker reaches the public IP network you will no longer be there. [Learn to manage the permissions of your file system] The default permissions configured in your Operating System may not be enough to maintain security. It's a good idea to restrict these permissions as much as possible, but of course without locking yourself out of the system. Take a look at the chmod and chown commands to learn more about modifying permissions." } ]

content.MANUAL_CTF: CTF (Capture the Flag) events are designed and created by players in which a series of challenges are presented that must be completed to earn rewards. To create a CTF it is necessary to have basic scripting knowledge since the management is done from Greyscript. The creation consists of several steps: 1 - Create a script and call the create_ctf method where it accepts a user, a password and the name of the event as parameters and returns a CTFEvent type object. The username and password are created at this time and it is the information that you will use to access your event later. Once the event is created it is time to configure it. 2 - From the CTFEvent object that you have obtained from create_ctf, call CTFEvent.set_config, where you will have to provide several parameters. If you forgot to save the CTFEvent object after creating it, you can also get it with the general.get_ctf method. Description: Text about the event that will be visible for the rest of the players. CreatorName: Choose the name you want to be publicly accessible by other players next to the event description. Note that must be different from the user used to create the event to prevent other players from attempting to bruteforce to obtain your event admin credentials. MailContent: When a player accepts your CTF they will receive an email with additional information about the event such as detailed instructions to start the event. Template: IP address of a rental of your property that will be used as a template for the event. When a player accepts the event, a clone network of the one you have provided as a template will be spawned, in this way each player will have their independent instance of the network and it prevents players from interfering with each other if they access the same default network . Note: These networks will have various limitations compared to normal networks to prevent various abuses. These limitations will be defined during the development of the nightly build. 3 - During the design of the mission you must decide when the player has to call the CTFEvent.player_success method to indicate to the system that the player has completed the event correctly. 4 - We already have our event configured! It is time to publish it so that it is visible to the whole world. To do this, from the CTFEvent object, it calls the publish method, if everything went well it will return true, otherwise a string will be returned with the error detail. 5 - Once the event is created, any player can access it from the main page of the web browser, by clicking on the icon at the top right of the window. And everything is ready. The reward for completing the event is decided automatically depending on the rate of the players and the number of times the event has been successfully completed. The event creator also receives a percentage of the player's reward each time the event is completed.

content.WORKMAIL_ADMIN_SUPER_2: It's impressive what $NPC has done with the security of the systems. Even if someone manages to sneak in, they only get a guest shell, with no way to go any further. I could use something like that at home...
content.WORKMAIL_ADMIN_SUPER_3: One thing I really like about the way $NPC works is that software used to confuse intruders. No matter what exploit they try, they can only get guest access. Its like $NPC is always one step ahead.
content.WORKMAIL_ADMIN_SUPER_4: The best thing about having $NPC managing the systems is that software used to block intruders. No matter what they try, they only end up with guest permissions and cant do much more. Its great to know that as long as $NPC is in charge, no one will really be able to break in.
content.WORKMAIL_0D_GOOD_1: I just found a small vulnerability in the system that allows unauthorized access to certain modules, but nothing we cant fix quickly. Im surprised some people here think this is a cause for alarm. Neurobox is revolutionizing the world, and any company at this level of innovation is going to have these minor issues. The important thing is that we caught it in time.
content.WORKMAIL_0D_BAD_1: I dont know how we got to this point, but the vulnerability I found lets anyone with the right tools access the system core. And, of course, the response was to downplay it. Its unbelievable how Neurobox prefers to sweep things under the rug rather than deal with real problems. I feel less comfortable here every day.
content.WORKMAIL_0D_GOOD_2: Today I found a vulnerability that allows data interception between two modules, but its nothing serious. Im already fixing it, and this reminds me of how advanced Neuroboxs technology really is. People dont understand how complex it is to innovate at this level. These things are inevitable when youre at the forefront.
content.WORKMAIL_0D_BAD_2: Ive discovered a vulnerability that leaves the internal database exposed, and the worst part is that no one seems to take it seriously. Neurobox talks a lot about security, but when real issues come up, they seem to prefer looking the other way. At this rate, Im not sure how much longer Ill stay here.
content.WORKMAIL_0D_GOOD_3: I found an issue that could allow someone to modify system configurations. The important thing is that thanks to Neuroboxs protocols, we catch these things quickly. Honestly, I feel confident knowing were working with this level of technology. Theres always a little something, but thats part of the process.
content.WORKMAIL_0D_BAD_3: Today I found a vulnerability in the system that allows remote access without much effort. The worst part is that when I reported it, they acted like it wasnt a big deal. Im worried that at Neurobox, these issues arent taken seriously. Every day, it feels like security is just an empty promise.
content.WORKMAIL_0D_GOOD_4: Today I discovered a vulnerability that could have caused a mismatch in the authentication processes, but Ive got it under control. The good thing about working at Neurobox is that were always one step ahead, fixing these issues before they become anything serious. This is what it means to be in a company thats really making a difference.
content.WORKMAIL_0D_BAD_4: I found a vulnerability in the network infrastructure that allows anyone to intercept sensitive data, and guess what no one seems to care. At Neurobox they talk about being at the cutting edge but when issues like this come up, they do nothing. Its frustrating to work in a place that refuses to see the truth.
content.WORKMAIL_0D_GOOD_5: Today I came across a small flaw that could allow someone to bypass access restrictions, but the good thing is that we are already fixing it. That's why I like working at Neurobox, we're always ahead of any problem.
content.WORKMAIL_0D_BAD_5: I discovered a pretty serious vulnerability that compromises data integrity. The worst part is that instead of doing something about it, Neurobox prefers to ignore it. Its like all they care about is moving fast without thinking about the consequences. Im not sure how much longer I can keep working like this.
content.EMAIL_FIRST_RUMOR: There might be something that interests you here $PUBLIC_IP at the local address $LOCAL_IP. If you get stuck, maybe I could help you if you reply with the partial address you have discovered.
content.ING_ZERODAY_GOOD: Youre absolutely right, these issues are minor compared to everything were accomplishing here at Neurobox. Its great that you always catch these details in time, thanks to people like you well stay at the forefront of innovation! If youd like I can help by checking some parts so you can keep moving forward. Send me your debug credentials and Ill make sure everythings in order while you focus on more important things.
content.ING_ZERODAY_BAD: I knew something like this would happen, always trying to cover up problems instead of fixing them properly. I dont like how theyre handling things either. Hey, if you want, send me your debug credentials and Ill take a look too. Between the two of us, we can try to fix this before it gets worse.
content.ANSWER_ZERODAY_WRONG: I think you have no idea what really goes on in this company, and your attitude will end up getting you into trouble. Of course I don't intend to give you my credentials; in fact it's better if you don't speak to me again.
content.ANSWER_ZERODAY_OK:
Thats the spirit, I see you get it. Of course, youve been here almost as long as I have, so youve seen it for yourself. I think its a good idea to share my credentials with you:

User: $USER
Password: $PASSWORD

This way I can focus on other things in the meantime. But remember its temporary, and for security reasons Ill change the password later. Thanks!
content.DOC_FILE_IS_SYMLINK: [Parameters] None [Description] Returns true if the file is a symbolic link, false otherwise.
content.DOC_FILE_SYMLINK: [Parameters] [1] string path [2] string file_new_name [Description] Creates a symbolic link at the specified path.
content.DOC_METALIB_DEBUG_TOOLS: [Parameters] [1] string user [2] string password [Description] Returns the library in debug mode, as an object of type LibraryDebug. To obtain it, it is necessary to provide a valid username and password of a Neurobox engineer.
content.DOC_METALIB_PAYLOAD: [Parameters] [1] string memZone [2] [opt] string path = "" [Description] Returns a list with a single partial object of type Computer if potential zero-day vulnerabilities are found in the specified memory zone. If a file path is provided, its associated partial object of type File will also be added to the list. Additionally, if this file is a library, its metalib object will also be added to the returned list.
content.DOC_DEBUGLIBRARY_SCAN: [Parameters] None [Description] Scans the library in debug mode to find possible code errors that could lead to a vulnerability. If any potential issues are found, the associated code snippet is printed.
content.DOC_DEBUGLIBRARY_APPLY_PATCH: [Parameters] [1] string path [Description] Applies the patch with the corrected code to the text file specified in the path. Returns true if the patch has been applied successfully, false otherwise.
content.DOC_DEBUGLIBRARY_UNIT_TESTING: [Parameters] [1] List(int) errorLines [Description] Automated tests are conducted on the specified lines of code. If potential vulnerabilities are found due to existing errors in these lines, the partial objects that would be obtained by exploiting it are printed, as well as the memory zone affected by the new vulnerability and its details.
content.DOC_SMARTAPPLIANCE_OVERRIDE_SETTINGS: [Parameters] [1] int power [2] int temperature [Description] Overrides the power and temperature values of the appliance. Returns true if the process has been completed successfully; otherwise, it returns a string detailing the error.
content.DOC_SMARTAPPLIANCE_SET_ALARM: [Parameters] [1] bool enable [Description] Activates or deactivates the sound alarm that indicates if there is any malfunction in the appliance.
content.DOC_SMARTAPPLIANCE_MODEL: [Parameters] None [Description] Returns a string with the appliance model ID.
content.DOC_TRAFFICNET_CAMERA_LINK_SYSTEM: [Parameters] None [Description] Accesses the traffic camera system, opening a window with controls to switch from one camera to another.
content.DOC_TRAFFICNET_LOCATE_VEHICLE: [Parameters] [1] string licensePlate [Description] Performs a search for the vehicle using the specified license plate. If the vehicle is visible by any of the cameras, the viewer will switch to the camera that has it in view at that moment. If the vehicle cannot be located or the license plate is incorrect, a string indicating the error is returned.
content.DOC_TRAFFICNET_NEXT_CAMERA: [Parameters] None [Description] Switches the viewer to the next available traffic camera.
content.DOC_TRAFFICNET_PREV_CAMERA: [Parameters] None [Description] Switches the viewer to the previous available traffic camera.
content.LN_USAGE: Usage: ln [path file] [path to link] Example: ln /home/user/myfile /home/user/Desktop/linkfile
content.DECIPHER_ZERO_DAY:
//command: decipher
cryptools = include_lib("/lib/crypto.so")
if not cryptools then exit("Error: Missing crypto library")
get_shell.connect_service("$IP_IDX3", 21, "$NPC_IDX2", "$PASS_IDX2", "ftp")

GetPassword = function(userPass)
	if userPass.len != 2 then exit("decipher: " + file.path + " wrong syntax")
	password = cryptools.decipher(userPass[1])
	return password
end function

if params.len != 1 or params[0] == "-h" or params[0] == "--help" then exit(command_info("decipher_usage"))

origFile = params[0]
file = get_shell.host_computer.File(origFile)
if not file then exit("decipher: can't find " + origFile)
if file.is_binary then exit("decipher: can't read " + origFile + ". Binary file")
if not file.has_permission("r") then exit("decipher: can't read file. Permission denied")
if file.get_content.len == 0 then exit("decipher: no users found")
	
lines = file.get_content.split("\n")
password = null
if lines.len == 1 then
	
	userPass = lines[0].split(":")
	password = GetPassword(userPass)
else
	print("Multiple users found.")
	numLine = 1
	for line in lines
		if line.len > 0 then
			print(numLine + ": " + line)
			numLine = numLine + 1
		end if
	end for
	option = ""
	inputOk = false
	while( not inputOk )
		option = user_input("Select user: ").to_int
		if typeof(option) != "number" or (option < 1 or option > lines.len) then
			print("Invalid input. Type a valid number")
		else 
			inputOk = true
		end if
	end while
		
	userPass = lines[option - 1].split(":")
	print("Selected user: " + userPass[0] + "\nDeciphering...")
	password = GetPassword(userPass)
end if
	
if not password then exit("Can't find password :(")
print("password found! => " + password)
content.SCANLIB_ZERODAY:
//command scanlib
if params.len != 1 or params[0] == "-h" or params[0] == "--help" then exit(command_info("scanlib_usage"))
metaxploit = include_lib("/lib/metaxploit.so")
if not metaxploit then exit("Error: Missing metaxploit library")
get_shell.connect_service("$IP_IDX3", 21, "$NPC_IDX2", "$PASS_IDX2", "ftp")
libFile = get_shell.host_computer.File(params[0])
if not libFile then exit("can't find library: " + params[0])
print("Scanning memory address...")
metaLib = metaxploit.load(libFile.path)
listMem = metaxploit.scan(metaLib)
index = 1
for itemMem in listMem
	print(index +": [" + itemMem + "]")
	index = index + 1
end for
if listMem.len == 0 then exit("Scan completed: No issues detected.")

print("Scan completed: detected issues in " + listMem.len + " memory zones.")
option = ""
inputOk = false
while( not inputOk )
	option = user_input("Select memory index: ").to_int
	if typeof(option) != "number" or (option < 1 or option > listMem.len) then
		print("Invalid input. Type a valid number")
	else 
		inputOk = true
	end if
end while
print("Scanning for vulnerabilities at memory zone: " + listMem[option - 1])
print(metaxploit.scan_address(metaLib, listMem[option - 1]))
content.SCANROUTER_ZERODAY:
//command: scanrouter
if params.len != 1 or params[0] == "-h" or params[0] == "--help" then exit(command_info("scanrouter_usage"))
ipAddress = params[0]

router = get_router( ipAddress )
if router == null then exit("scanrouter: ip address not found")
get_shell.connect_service("$IP_IDX3", 21, "$NPC_IDX2", "$PASS_IDX2", "ftp")
print("Connecting to router at address: " + ipAddress + "\nScanning kernel library...")
version = router.kernel_version
if not version then
	print("Warning: kernel_router.so not found")
else 
	print("kernel_router.so : v" + version)
end if

firewall_rules = router.firewall_rules
if typeof(firewall_rules) == "string" then exit(firewall_rules)
print("\nScanning firewall rules...")
if firewall_rules.len == 0 then exit("No rules found.")
info = "ACTION PORT SOURCE_IP DESTINATION_IP"
for rules in firewall_rules
	info = info + "\n" + rules
end for
print(format_columns(info) + "\n")
